title: Schedule
content:

Topic:Fundamentals 1:The Needs and Opportunities of Robots
Goal:We will start with a broad perspective about opportunities for robots and research progress over a longer horizon.
Collaborative Robots and Industrial Revolution 4.0 (IR 4.0) The Evolution of Robotics Research â€” From Industrial Robotics to Field and Service Robotics Class 4 â€” Thu, Jan 29, 2026
Topic:Fundamentals 2:Moving Your Robot & System Complexity
Goal:Robot research often involves deploying full-stack systems and inverse kinematics techniques.
DexPilot:Vision-Based Teleoperation of Dexterous Robotic Handâ€“Arm Systems RelaxedIK:Real-time Synthesis of Accurate and Feasible Robot Arm Motion Class 5 â€” Tue, Feb 3, 2026

Goal:Review of common planning techniques and modern optimization-based approaches.
Motion Planning:The Essentials Motion Planning Around Obstacles with Convex Optimization Additional Resources: Collision-Affording Point Trees(recent high-performance path planning RSS paper) ðŸ¤– Module 2: Learning# Class 6 â€” Thu, Feb 5, 2026
